title: Normal Characteristics
question_text: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of the standard normal distribution?

choices.text: The area beneath the standard normal distribution curve is exactly equal to $1$.
The mean is $0$ and the standard deviation is $1$.
The curve is bell-shaped and symmetric about its peak which occurs at the median.
The distribution contains higher frequencies for values near the center and smaller frequencies for values to the far left and far right of the center.
As the sample size increases, the standard deviation will decrease.

solution:
While it is true that the standard deviation of a sampling distribution will decrease as the sample size increases, the standard deviation of the standard normal distribution is always $1$.

Choices 'A', 'B', 'C' and 'D' all accurately describe characteristics of the standard normal distribution. For Choice 'C', remember that the mean and median of the normal distribution curve are equal.
